item.title: Request for zebra crossing outside school, 6th November
item.description:
Would it be possible for the council to consider installing a zebra crossing and dropped curbs to Church Road, immediately outside Uplands School? At peak times, it is quite dangerous to cross with children, especially when travelling with a buggy, or toddlers on scooters. This is not helped by parents parking in no parking zones.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Report of Illegal Waste Dumping (Fly-tipping, 6th November
item.description:
On Thursday, 6 November, at around 19:09, a van with the registration number BG09 HFA was seen dumping rubbish on the street near postcode SE7 8NF. The driver stopped the vehicle and disposed of waste illegally on the public road, causing litter and an environmental hazard. Please investigate this incident and take any appropriate action.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Lydenburg Street, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface is crumbling onto the pavement, 6th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Belvedere Road, London

item.title: Pitch black streets unsafe - no lights, 6th November
item.description:
No street lighting is working the entire length of Molesworth St and part of Lewisham High Street making it very unsafe for females to walk home alone after work in the early evening when it's pitch black already. It's been this way for weeks, is our safety not important? There have been many stabbings in the local area these past few weeks. Please make the area as safe as you can - lights are a basic thing we should have.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 207, Lewisham High Street, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row

item.title: Manhole broken, 6th November
item.description:
This manhole is broken now at least 4 months.. it has been reported by myself and a neighbour of mine many times but we always get a “fixed “reply back to us. This is REALLY affecting all our sleep and it is actually keeping my kids awake at night as they cannot sleep with this constant banging ALL night. We urgently need this fixed as it is a huge nuisance to us all. Please do not give us a reply fixed back.. yous have to come out and hear this constant banging for yourselves as we are all getting very frustrated with all this. We await you. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chester Way, Kennington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree covering street light., 6th November
item.description:
All along the river path the trees are overgrown and blocking out the street lights. I've lived on Montana Gardens for over 13 years and I've never seen this area so badly neglected! Bromley council and First Port management company are supposed to be maintaining this path and river bank but neither are doing anything! Have I got to go down to the river path and maintain it myself?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montana Gardens, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not functioning leaving the road is very dark and unsafe, especially for elderly and mobility-impaired pedestrians., 6th November
item.description:
The street light on Cumberland St, just before Sutherland Row, is currently out of order. With the extended darkness during winter hours, the road has become unsafe for pedestrians, particularly elderly and mobility-impaired residents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cumberland Street, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Highgate High Street at junction of South Grove, 6th November
item.description:
The closure of one lane of traffic on Highgate High Street where it meets South Grove, with temporary traffic lights restricting the traffic flow, is completely unnecessary and has been causing huge problems in Highgate for the past couple of weeks. The work is actually at least 10 metres away on South Grove, and there is no reason for the partial closure of the High Street. I spoke to someone working there today and even he couldn’t understand why the High Street was restricted. He just said the council asked for it. I beg you to come and see for yourself - the congestion backs up right through Highgate down towards Archway and spills on to surrounding roads, the schools add to the congestion, no-one can get through Highgate, the buses are delayed, there is terrible pollution caused by all the idling cars, and no-one here can understand why the lane is closed. Please reopen the High Street as soon as possible. I would be very happy to talk to you about this if you have time to call me.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Highgate High Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet
